tag_list: storycub, ithink-group, swerdlick, education, content, digital, distribution
overview:
Developer and distributor of children’s educational and entertainment content for digital platforms.

A marketing strategist known for conceptualizing and executing on dynamic audience growth opportunities in all forms of digital media, he has a thorough understanding of the convergence of audio and video content on various platforms and a dynamic record of achievement in a rapidly changing industry.

Having worked for some of the largest record companies in the world including MCA/Universal, Arista, and most notably Columbia Records for a decade of his career, Dave has worked with and produced several television properties that further advanced the careers of Bruce Springsteen, Mariah Carey, Aerosmith, Beyoncé, Tony Bennett, Train, and many others.

His own company developed and licensed children’s music including the “My Name Is” series, a Target Stores exclusive.

Always looking for new ways to merge children’s content and digital media, Dave was one of the early adopters of podcasting. Starting in 2006 he created and produced 110 episodes of the “Webkinz Webcast”. The show was downloaded by millions and commonly found in the “Top 10″ of iTunes “Kids and Family” section.

He currently produces the Kid Friday podcast, a show he created with his 11 and 14-year old daughters. “Kid Friday” is the #1 technology podcast for kids and earned Top 10 recognition in the “Best Education” and “People’s Choice” categories at the 2011 Podcast Awards.

Dave also has an exclusive partnership with Great Knight Productions, the leading management and booking agent of children’s music in the United States. With a relationship that goes back more than 20-years, they focus on artist development and management. Among their work together, they co-manage Aaron Nigel Smith, a featured guest on the PBS series “Between the Lions” and winner of an iParenting Media award and Nappa honors.

milestones.description: StoryCub launched on iTunes in the "Kids and Family" podcast section.
StoryCub goes #1 in the iTunes "Kids and Family" podcast section.
